newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo naphtha rebounds on overnight crude gains.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo naphtha rebounds on overnight crude gains.

text.p: Naphtha bounced up on the back of overnight crude gains in a quiet Friday market, traders said.
Second-half October open-spec naphtha was notionally assessed bid at $195 and offered at $196, while first-half November was assessed bid and offered at about 50 cents in backwardation.
First-half October was notionally assessed bid and offered at $196/$197. One trader said that market discussion for first-half October was slowly dwindling to a close.
The intra-month spread was assessed at about $1/$1.50 for second-half October and second-half November.
This was after an overnight deal was done at $1.25 for second-half October and second-half November.
Market participants continued to assess the jet/kerosene market for a clue to market direction ahead of moves to cover winter requirements, traders said.
Industry sources said Indonesia's state-owned Pertamina has allocated 3.6 million barrels of LSWR for lifting in September.
A Japanese trader said the volume was within market expectations, but it was still too early to say how the volume would influence market sentiment.
